lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Write a program that takes a string as input and checks if it is "almost" a palindrome. A string is considered "almost a palindrome" if it can be made a palindrome by changing only one character. If the string is already a palindrome, the program should return "Already a palindrome". Otherwise, if it is not possible to make the string a palindrome by changing just one character, it should return "Not a palindrome".
Input
A string S (without spaces or special characters) to check for the "almost a palindrome" condition.
Output
Already a palindrome if the input string is already a palindrome.
Almost a palindrome if you can make the string a palindrome by changing only one character.
Not a palindrome if the string cannot be a palindrome even with one character change.
Constraints
1 ≤ |S| ≤ 100 (where |S| is the length of the string)
The string will only contain lowercase alphabetic characters (a-z).
Example
Input
ab
Output
Almost a palindrome
